title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python (likely for backend services), HTML, and CSS, intended to provide a visual overview and control panel for the Robofleet robotics platform. This project focuses on creating a user-friendly dashboard for monitoring and managing robots and their tasks within the Robofleet ecosystem, falling under the broader topic of robotics project development.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: This repository hosts a simple CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) expense tracker application built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. The project leverages Material-UI for a clean and responsive user interface, providing a user-friendly way to manage and track personal expenses. It serves as a practical example for learning and implementing basic CRUD operations within a modern web development environment.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a Next.js 14 project built with TypeScript, leveraging the pages router, Material UI (MUI), and React Query. It serves as a personal development dashboard, offering a central hub to organize and track projects, manage tasks, and visualize progress, while demonstrating modern web development practices and showcasing proficiency in these key technologies.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, aiming to [**Insert project's primary function/goal - e.g., "create a comprehensive task management application," or "develop a real-time collaborative document editor"**]. It leverages modern web development practices and explores concepts within the [**Mention specific topics from README/general understanding - e.g., "state management, UI component design, and asynchronous programming."**] This repository serves as the code base for the Raven v2 project and is a demonstration of [**Mention key aspects - e.g., "building scalable and maintainable web applications."**].

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository serves as a practical example for learning and implementing dashboard functionalities, focusing on clean architecture, reusable components, and a visually appealing user interface.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript to provide a platform for brainstorming, organizing, and developing ideas. This interactive idea board allows users to create, manage, and collaborate on projects by visualizing them in a dynamic and intuitive way. Leveraging modern web development techniques, it aims to streamline the creative process and foster collaboration.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, and CSS. This project demonstrates a robust system for creating, reading, updating, and deleting data, providing a practical example of a web application using common web development technologies and architectural patterns. It's designed as a learning resource and showcases best practices for developing Python-based web applications with database integration.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project leveraging HTML and Python to generate interactive map visualizations. This repository explores techniques for displaying geographical data and creating engaging visual representations of location-based information. The project aims to provide a foundation for understanding and working with geospatial data using web-based technologies.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains a collection of Jupyter Notebooks demonstrating practical finance applications using Python. Focusing on project-based learning, it explores various financial concepts and methodologies through code, providing hands-on experience in areas like portfolio optimization, risk management, and financial modeling. The project leverages Python's powerful libraries to analyze financial data and build useful tools for investment analysis.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that allows users to create and participate in polls. Leveraging Next.js for a fast and efficient user experience, this project demonstrates a practical implementation of a voting system, showcasing concepts related to web development, user interaction, and potentially authentication and data persistence (depending on the README). It serves as a learning resource and example project for those interested in building interactive web applications.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to help users visualize and manage their sleep patterns, aiming to highlight and address potential sleep debt. This application allows users to input their sleep data and provides a clear visual representation of their sleep deficit or surplus, encouraging better sleep hygiene and overall health. This project serves as a practical demonstration of TypeScript and front-end development skills.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the TeX source code and generated HTML output for my resume. It serves as a project showcasing my ability to create and manage professional documents using LaTeX and transform them into web-friendly formats. The project demonstrates how to structure a resume effectively using TeX and present it in a polished, accessible manner.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and styled with Tailwind CSS. Leveraging Supabase for backend services, this project demonstrates a real-time asset management solution, exploring key concepts in IoT, web development, and database integration within a single, cohesive application.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project that allows users to create and manage a dynamic, visually appealing event calendar. Built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this repository provides a flexible framework for displaying events and managing event data, offering a user-friendly interface and customizable styling options. This project serves as a practical example of front-end development techniques and calendar implementation.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focused on [insert project's main functionality/purpose here, e.g., visualizing geographic data, managing a to-do list, or creating a personal portfolio]. This repository showcases [mention key features or technologies, e.g., interactive map components, state management with React, or responsive design techniques] while exploring concepts related to general project development.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python (for backend processing), HTML, and CSS, this project aims to provide a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and understanding ROS logs, making debugging and performance analysis easier. It falls under the "project" topic and offers a convenient way to interpret the often verbose output generated by ROS-based systems.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, utilizing Vite.js for a fast and modern development experience, Express.js for the backend API, and Gemini API for AI-powered conversational features. This project showcases a practical implementation of integrating AI into a web application, focusing on clean code and utilizing modern web development practices with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a Next.js 14 e-commerce platform built with TypeScript and JavaScript, showcasing best practices for building scalable and maintainable web applications. Leveraging the Next.js Pages Router, MUI for UI components, and React Query for data fetching and caching, this project provides a type-safe implementation for selling fruit online, demonstrating key concepts in modern web development within the context of e-commerce.
